full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 171 of 228 847 LC2Qmax5 - corrected Alessi - Direct

1 Q. Was it the same person massaging Epstein at each appointment or a different person?
2 A. They were different persons.
3 Q. Who scheduled Mr. Epstein's massages?
4 A. Ms. Maxwell, Mr. Epstein, or sometimes even the office people in New York, they would call me and ask me to schedule the massages.
5 Q. When you scheduled the massages, what did you do?
6 A. I went to my office, and I had a Rolodex with all the massage therapists, and whoever they told me to call, I would call that person, and I will ask if they're available for this time. It was a different times of the day. And if they said yes, I would confirm with Ms. Maxwell or Mr. Epstein that she was coming.
7 Q. And who do you remember telling you which person to call to come give Mr. Epstein a massage?
8 A. Either was Ms. Maxwell, Mr. Epstein, or the office.
9 Q. Other than you, who else, if anyone, would call to schedule massages?
10 A. At the end, Ms. Kellen.
11 Q. Now, you said that closer to the end, Mr. Epstein was getting three massages a day?
12 A. Yes.
13 Q. What time of day typically were those massages?
14 A. It was all different times of day. It was a massage in the

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00012456
